programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jerry and Christine Steele's love of South Africa began decades ago and they have decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the beaches and national parks of the Garden Route stretch of the south-eastern coast. For their budget of £60,000, Laura Hamilton shows them five great value properties.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Lee and Lynn Fox from South Yorkshire have been regular visitors to the Tuscan city of Lucca since Lee's job as a mechanical engineer first took him there over 10 years ago. Lynn's hairdressing business and Lee's job keep the couple very busy, so making the most of their quality time together is key. Laura Hamilton makes it her mission to show them a variety of properties as close to the city centre as possible, on a budget of £170,000.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan considers an Olympic football signed by the Team GB women and a 200-year-old picture with a royal connection. A monster sound system attracts the team in Brighton.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In south east London, Nathan and Debbs are taken aback by a ventriloquist's dummy, while in Sheffield, Dan appraises a classic campervan and considers one of his biggest ever deals.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick Pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick inspect a collection of boxing memorabilia owned by former boxing promoter Kellie Maloney, as well as an unusual electric unicycle. At London Road in Sheffield, Dan has a diamond encrusted bracelet in his sights, and is also considering deals on two high-end leather belts and a huge collection of coins featuring some of the world's most dangerous creatures.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Deals on the table today include a cross between a motorbike and a boat, rare vintage champagne, an unusual mechanical calculator, and an Aboriginal weapon known as a nulla nulla.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fallen by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef visits beachside restaurant Barefoot Bob's in Hull, Massachusetts, owned by husband-and-wife team Marc and Lisa. Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters aren't improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before it's too late.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, where he meets a stubborn owner who doesn't react well to criticism. Tom bought the restaurant for his daughter Andrea, but six years later he's still refusing to let her run it. Can the chef break Tom's iron grip on the business and persuade him to change his outdated approach?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Beaver, Pennsylvania, where he meets a brother-and-sister team who find it almost impossible to work together. Their relationship is so fractured that they're failing to save their father's Italian restaurant from being overwhelmed by local competition, and the situation has become so desperate that their dad is in danger of losing his life savings.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Pioneering veterinarian Noel Fitzpatrick plans to use groundbreaking cell technology to repair damaged cartilage in a 10-month-old golden retriever that helps a five-year-old girl cope with epilepsy. A cat arrives at the surgery with a suspected rat bite that seems to be getting bigger, and a whippet is brought in after being hit by a car - sustaining multiple pelvic fractures.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Stephen Mangan teaming up against Noel Fielding and Fay Ripley. The Brett Domino Trio are in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: New series. The first of a new six-part run in which the nation's younger viewers maintain a close eye on a range of TV output. This series sees the existing army of junior sofa critics supplemented by newcomers Roma, Joel, Jack, Sadie, Declan, Amelinda and Yoanna, who join in to offer their honest, inimitable and ultimately hilarious take on recent shows to hit the small-screen. Items under scrutiny in this opening edition include coverage of the General Election, culinary queen Mary Berry and the classic movie Grease.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Professional singer Precious seeks romance with amateur magician Earle. The restaurant also welcomes company director John, who hopes fellow Scot Greig is the man he can settle down with. And fellow diner Hebe is on the verge of giving up on finding Mr Right. Hopefully she will connect with fine wine merchant Charles.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after being involved in a road traffic collision, with consultants concerned that she may have life-threatening internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 80-year-old Mohammad has come to A&E after falling at home during a family Eid celebratory feast, and 56-year-old Russ is brought in after falling from a ladder while cutting back some trees at work.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three young men from different walks of life are brought in to the A&E department of St George's Hospital in London, including 17-year-old Shea, who has serious stab wounds and is sent to a high dependency unit. Fellow 17-year-old Bob arrives after impaling his leg on a fence while taking a shortcut home from his boys' school, and 33-year-old James is brought in by ambulance after fainting at home.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Two more singletons choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who will be revealed to them one body part at a time. Single mum Tracy from Bedfordshire has been out of the dating game since she split with her fiancee three years ago and hopes to find a man who matches her adventurous side, while London sales advisor Matthew, 24, is tired of dating apps and thinks online profiles mean girls never actually see the real him. Anna Richardson hosts.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fallen by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring The Spy Who Loved Me, Andrew Neil with Jeremy Corbyn, the SNP's Manifesto, Paul Hollywood's Continental Road Trip, the Green Party and SNP's Party Election Broadcasts, Your Face or Mine, Great British Skinny Dip and the News.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Ever since Terry Windle and Julia Lenart got together 15 years ago, they have dreamed of having their own place in sunnier climes - and have decided Gran Canaria is the perfect place for them. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: The Caribbean island of Nevis is very close to Steven and Murila Fifer's hearts. Murila was born there, and the couple have visited the place together many times over the years. They have now decided their dream holiday home should be on the island, so Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties within their £330,000 budget. Will they fall for a country villa or a beach-side home?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Farzana Kausar from Stockport to find a home in Torrevieja on Spain's Costa Blanca that will be accessible for her daughter Aisha's wheelchair.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Gary and Susie, who want to start a new adventure in Florida's beautiful Sarasota Keys. For their budget of £220,000 they're after a place to escape the British winters, as close to the amazing beaches of the Gulf of Mexico as possible. Jonnie shows them how far their budget will stretch in this highly desirable corner of the US.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jerry and Christine Steele's love of South Africa began decades ago and they have decided to spend part of their retirement in a second home among the beaches and national parks of the Garden Route stretch of the south-eastern coast. programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Experts Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help Chipping Norton duo Leanne and Ricky look for a property in Scotland, with a budget of £220,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: David Bull and Kirsty Duffy help retired couple Tim and Sue find their forever home together in Somerset, searching both coastal and countryside properties on a budget of £390,000.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chef's attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentist's waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he earlier tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or fallen by the wayside. First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri.(n)

programme.title: Ackley Bridge
programme.desc: New series. A six-part school drama series set in a Yorkshire mill town with a largely divided white and Asian population, as two formerly isolated comprehensive schools are merged into a brand new academy. In the first episode, English teacher Emma gets a shock when she finds out she's now working with her ex-boyfriend, while best friends and neighbours Missy and Nas attend school together for the first time.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: New series. Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Jim's wife leaves him and Kerry annoys Bridget by dyeing her hair blonde. Meanwhile, the family therapist convinces Cate that she should pursue her dream of becoming a singer.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part two of two. Junior finally graduates, prompting proud parents Michael and Jay to reward him with an all-expenses-paid trip to Japan - which they also see as a way of ruining his plans to move in with Vanessa.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: The housemates gather on the sofas as Emma Willis hosts the first eviction of the series, revealing who the public have voted out, then chatting to them about their five days on the show. programme.title: Free Birds

A rogue bird hijacks a time machine and takes them both back to pilgrim times on a mission to prevent turkeys becoming the traditional holiday meal. Animated comedy, with the voices of Owen Wilson and Woody Harrelson.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

Drama, starring Will Smith, Rosario Dawson, Woody Harrelson and Barry Pepper.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: The case of Ty Medland, who in February 2013 stabbed his wife Samantha to death in a public square in Brighton after posting indecent pictures of her on a social media website. The programme features candid interviews with Sam's mother Amelia Greening, as well as experts from the Sussex Major Crime Team and criminologist Elizabeth Yardley.(n)

programme.title: Inside the World's Toughest Prisons
programme.desc: Paul Connolly experiences life as an inmate in the impoverished Philippines jail system, where many prisons are overcrowded, severely under-funded and run by gangs. Two thirds of the country's prisoners have yet to face trial - they are arrested, charged and then left to languish on remand, with many spending years in legal limbo thanks to the archaic judicial system. During his time behind bars Paul shares a cell with a convicted murder and a rapist, meets a cop killer whose past catches up with him and sees first-hand how a ruthless gang rules one prison with almost military control.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael goes camping with Kady and her friends, while Clare and Tony plan to sneak out to a rave. Starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing the housemates' reactions to the first eviction, as well as the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs and diary room visits. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The officers chase a debt of almost £2,000 in unpaid parking fines, and later encounter the extraordinary case of a debt of £80,000 owed by a hotel owner to his ex-girlfriend. However, as they begin to search the property, they call upon police back-up as the agents fear the debtor may have access to firearms. Elsewhere, two officers head to a car garage in Manchester where the owner owes £2,000 after losing a court case over a faulty vehicle.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: In south London, Del and Dael Anglin receive a hostile reception from the brother of a debtor who has alreasy defaulted on a promise to pay £2,000 she owes to a storage company. In Worcestershire, Gareth and Craig try to recover £45,000 from a young online entrepreneur, who claims no responsibility for the debt he owes to his courier. Their target cooks up a flimsy lie in an effort to absolve himself, but dishonesty proves to be the least of the agents' worries when they discover a stash of guns at the back of the garage. In east London, an Indian restaurant owner begins to take his financial responsibilities seriously when Del and Dael start removing cookers and freezers from his premises, and a pair of pensioners in Oxfordshire hope the High Court will provide them a lifeline as they try to pay off a £4,000 bill to a solicitors' firm after a failed compensation claim.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The agents have an explosive run-in with a debtor as they try to retrieve £1,800 owed by a car dealership, and in Derbyshire, two officers try to collect more than £1,500 in unpaid parking fines. Elsewhere, Max and Paul are in London as they attempt to recover £2,000 owed by a property company, but an employee refuses to let them enter.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of people struggling to live on state welfare, something made all the more difficult by their individual battles with the bulge. Blossom lives in Brighton and has various health problems. Now she has discovered she many have cervical cancer and needs exploratory surgery - but at 25 stone, doctors have told her she is too fat to go under general anaesthetic. In Bexhill, Gina and Gary claim more than £10,000 a year in benefits. Gina has always been big but now she worries she has symptoms of diabetes. Archie near Manchester tips the scales at 26 stone and hasn't had a full-time job for six years. However, for four weeks of the year he earns money dressing up as Father Christmas.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: People facing benefit problems in Wales, including a Tredegar man who bemoans the lack of opportunities in the Valleys and a Newport woman who wants a new flat and is thinking about having a baby - but needs a loan before any of that can happen. Plus, a man who had a successful business but lost everything. After a spell of homelessness, he now has a place to call home.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Franky asks Jianna's son to help prove her innocence, and Liz's decision to testify against Sonia has serious repercussions in court. Drama, starring Nicola da Silva.(n)

programme.title: The Butcher Surgeon: Why Wasn't He Stopped
programme.desc: Documentary profiling former breast surgeon Ian Paterson, who was recently convicted of intentionally wounding patients by performing needless operations for more than a decade. Paterson was found guilty on 17 counts, and this programme examines how was he able to continue for so long, asking whether his employers might have ignored or failed to act on a series of warnings stretching back to 2003. Some of Paterson's victims are also interviewed, along with health service whistleblowers.(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Gripping, all-action sci-fi thriller about a cyborg who is sent back from the future, where machines rule the earth, to kill an apparently innocent woman who in fact holds the key to the survival of the human race. A lone protector is sent to save her - but which one will reach her first? Schwarzenegger is perfectly cast as the seemingly unstoppable cyborg and, true to his line 'I'll be back', returned in a 1991 sequel(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: Thrilling action fantasy starring Kevin Costner as a freedom fighter in a world where dry land has disappeared. The ice caps have long since melted and the planet is almost entirely covered in water(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a rowdy gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: LA journalist Steve Lopez begins writing a column about a mentally ill homeless man with a talent for playing the cello. Lopez tries to help improve his life, but finds his new friend's state of mind a stumbling block. Drama(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Carol Fuchs adapts writer/director Sandra Nettelbeck's screenplay for the 2001 romantic drama Mostly Martha for this Scott Hicks directed remake starring Catherine Zeta-Jones, Aaron Eckhart, and Patricia Clarkson. Kate Armstrong (Jones) is the master chef who is equally intense both in and out of the kitchen. Though Kate's "Type A" personality serves her well when whipping up meals in the trendy Manhattan eatery where she has made a name for herself, it threatens to sink her when she is named as the guardian of her nine-year-old niece Zoe (Little Miss Sunshine's Abigail Breslin). To complicate matters, an impetuous new sous chef named Nick Palmer (Eckhart) has recently joined the kitchen staff and his freewheeling personality seems to stand in direct opposition to Kate's unwavering perfectionism. Yet, despite the fact that they couldn't be more different on the surface, there's no denying the strong attraction between Kate and Nick. As the rivalry between the competitive cooks gradually gives way to romance, the lessons learned by compromising in the kitchen reveal to Kate the importance of learning to openly express herself in order to truly connect with Zoe and find romance with the good-natured Nick(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Young widow Holly Kennedy discovers that her late husband has left her ten monthly messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life. Adapted from Cecelia Ahern's best-selling novel. Starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler, Kathy Bates and Lisa Kudrow(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: An ambitious corporate troubleshooter is stranded on a deserted island for five years, eventually returning to society as a changed man(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: After a disastrous summer, Harry returns to begin his fifth year at Hogwarts, one of the toughest he will ever have. A few group of students and parents believe him or Dumbledore that Voldemort is really back, and a never-ending series of articles states that they are insane. On top of that, Dolores Umbridge, the new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher, proves to be the nastiest person Harry has ever encountered(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: Remake of the Japanese horror hit about a strange videotape. Whoever watches it is told they have seven days to live. A reporter tracks down the tape and has a week to solve the mystery(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: When a young girl begins acting strangely, her mother seeks out a priest, who is convinced the child is possessed by a demon(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Max Payne is a widowed cop hell-bent on delivering justice no matter what the cost as he investigates a string of killings in his city(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A stolen painting and a crooked land deal intertwines the destinies of a Russian mobster, a London gangster and a junkie punk rocker in writer-director Guy Ritchie's stylish and clever caper film starring Gerard Butler ("300") and Tom Wilkinson ("John Adams")(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: Adriana is a 13-year-old girl from Mexico City whose kidnapping by sex traffickers sets in motion a desperate mission by her 17-year-old brother, Jorge, to save her(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Oliver Stone 's scorching drama of a young dealer seduced by money and power, who hooks up with a high-powered company trader. Michael Douglas won an Oscar for his performance as stockbroking devil Gordon Gekko(n)

programme.title: Starring Adam West
programme.desc: Actor Adam West is profiled(n)

programme.title: Doctor Detroit
programme.desc: An ineffectual professor (Dan Aykroyd) becomes involved with the underworld when he is forced to go undercover as a pimp. As it turns out, the life rather suits "Dr. Detroit," and he becomes a minor celebrity(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Based on the true story of how Charlie Wilson, an alcoholic womaniser and Texas congressman, persuaded the CIA to train and arm resistance fighters in Afghanistan to fend off the Soviet Union. With the help of rogue CIA agent, Gust Avrakotos, the two men supplied money, training and a team of military experts that turned the ill-equipped Afghan freedom-fighters into a force that brought the Red Army to a stalemate and set the stage for conflicts in the Middle East that still rage to this day(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn. This gut-busting comedy is a sequel to the 2012 surprise hit(n)

programme.desc: Challenged to find the truth about a man sentenced to death, Harvard professor Paul stumbles on police corruption in a backwater town. But is he trying to save the right man?(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: In this thrilling fourth installment of the "Jurassic Park" franchise, two young brothers visit an aunt who's an executive at Jurassic World, a theme park populated with genetically resurrected dinosaurs. But chaos erupts when a newly created dino escapes its enclosure, forcing the park's animal behaviorist to save the day(n)

programme.title: Joy
programme.desc: Biopic of entrepreneur Joy Mangano, a divorced mother of two who risks her life's savings to produce and market her invention, the Miracle Mop. The success of that product leads to a home-shopping empire and her ascension to matriarch of her family(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company, and unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: In this thrilling and inspirational sci-fi drama, a lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: Walt receives a call from a man about a distressed young woman in his store, but later finds the shopkeeper has been killed and the girl has run off. Walt calls on Henry and the Ferg to help track her down and they pick up a trail that leads to a rabbit hutch, where they find an abandoned baby.(n)

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: When the president of the tribal council is found dead in his car on county land, it is clear to Walt that the body has been moved from the original crime scene. He discovers that the victim had a gambling problem and delves into the seedy world of an illegal poker game held in a tattoo parlour. Meanwhile, the sheriff also deals with feelings of betrayal when he finds out Cady and Branch are having an affair.(n)

programme.title: The Art of Murder: Garage Sale Mystery 7
programme.desc: While busy preparing for a charity garage sale event, an antique store owner discovers a body in the attic of a nearby home. Drama, starring Lori Loughlin, Steve Bacic and Eva Bourne.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Try and Catch Me
programme.desc: A grieving crime writer blames her niece's husband for her death and concocts a plan to take revenge, luring him to her walk-in vault, before locking him in and leaving him to die. She then puts her knowledge of the criminal mind to good use by covering her tracks, and although Columbo strongly suspects foul play, he finds clues are thin on the ground. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk and Ruth Gordon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Hetty enlists the help of a former colleague when an ex-Navy intelligence officer is murdered, but things go awry when her old friend threatens to kill her. The team races to save Hetty and expose her one-time workmate as having lied to the victim in order to make money from a seemingly charitable venture.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a dishonourably discharged marine is accused of beating a Japanese tourist to death, having already been linked with the rape of a businessman's daughter. He claims that he is in love with the girl he is alleged to have raped, and that the accusations being thrown in his direction are a fabrication initiated by her father.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a naval seaman and an infamous arms dealer are found dead near the Mexican border. Evidence suggests the men were trying to smuggle a wooden box into the US, but there is no sign of the container, nor any clue as to what could be inside. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam heads to Sudan to help a CIA agent gather evidence of al-Qaeda terrorist training, but Callen is forced to rush to the country too, when one of them is killed while carrying out the mission. Crime drama, starring LL Cool J and Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Deeks places his job in danger when he shoots and kills an unarmed man during a mission to retrieve Semtex explosives from a marine warehouse, prompting unexpected emotions for Kensi as she contemplates losing her partner. Crime drama, starring Eric Christian Olsen and Daniela Ruah.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen, Hanna and the team search for a group of terrorists suspected of murdering an ex-army sergeant. Meanwhile, Deeks and Kensi continue to bond. Starring Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the parades and parties at Mardi Gras after a petty officer is found murdered. Money and possessions were still on the deceased's body, so Pride rules out robbery as a motive and security footage suggests the victim had already been stabbed before he even made it to the event. More worryingly, further investigations lead to a tip-off about an upcoming `heist' at the festivities. Stacy Keach guest stars, with Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After navy recruiter Maggie Barringer is targeted in a fatal hit-and-run incident, Chris and Meredith learn she was foster mother to two teenage brothers. Advised the youngsters will be separated, Pride and Dr Wade plead for compassion, but agency worker Sumner St Croix is strangely adamant. While the duo contemplate whether Maggie's murder was tied to her career or to her role as a foster mother, Chris becomes increasingly concerned about the welfare of his brother Cade.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An assistant district attorney is found strangled in his car in an area notorious for prostitution. Benson is shocked to realise she briefly dated the victim and refuses to believe he would have paid for sex. As investigations get under way, DNA evidence reveals the dead man might have been gay. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The rape and murder of a criminology student puts detectives Stabler and Benson on the trail of a killer with an expert knowledge of forensics. A discovery about the victim's mentor places him at the top of their list of suspects - but as further evidence is gathered, it begins to seem that someone might have tried to frame him for the crime.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detective Munch becomes personally involved in the prosecution of a terminally ill embryologist who is accused of assisting a depressed woman in committing suicide. Evidence points overwhelmingly to her guilt - but the jury finds it hard to decide her fate. Hard-hitting police drama, guest starring Marlee Matlin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate the murder of an elderly woman who they learn was dying of cancer but had been determined to live out her final days to the full - a philosophy that encompassed dating a variety of men. Discovering her most recent gentleman callers all have alibis, they turn their attention to the murder weapon and realise they are looking for a serial killer. Anthony Rapp and Jane Krakowski guest star.(n)

The plan, a propaganda exercise propagated by Army chief George C Marshall, sees them reluctantly give up on their mission to defeat Germans and set out on their quest (although not without diversions along the way). But when they eventually find Ryan, the moral question posed by Spielberg is - what do they do next?(n)

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: Hondo is so "perfect" a John Ford western that many people assume it was directed by John Ford--or at the very least, Andrew McLaglen. Actually the director was suspense expert John Farrow, who worked with the "Duke" only twice in his career (the second film was an oddball war drama, The Sea Chase [55]). In Hondo, John Wayne plays a hard-bitten cavalry scout who is humanized by frontierswoman Geraldine Page and her young son (Lee Aaker, star of TV's Rin Tin Tin). Try as he might, Wayne can't convince Page to move off her land in anticipation of an Apache attack. He leaves her ranch, only to be ambushed by desperado Leo Gordon--who happens to be Page's long-absent husband. Having killed Gordon, Hondo returns to the ranch to protect Page from the Indians, and to rekindle the woman's hesitant love for him. The climactic attack sequence is enhanced by Hondo's 3-D photography, one of the few truly effective utilizations of this much-maligned process. Long unavailable thanks to the labyrinthine legal tangles of the John Wayne estate, Hondo was finally released to videotape in the early 1990s(n)

(Mike Farrell) have had a bellyful of Frank's brilliant but insufferably arrogant replacement, the aristocratic Maj. Charles Emerson Winchester II (David Ogden Stiers). Likewise discomfited is Winchester, especially when his temporary assignment to the 4077th threatens to become permanent. programme.desc: TEOTWAWKI. Still finding their place, Alicia and Nick fall in with new crowds; while Madison discovers Otto's past mimics that of her own(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Epic romantic adventure, set just prior to World War II, about an English aristocrat and the rugged drover who helps her with the cattle station she inherited(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Stephen Glass is a staff writer for the respected - current events and policy magazine - The New Republic, and a freelance feature writer for Rolling Stone Magazine and others. By the mid-90s, Glass' articles had turned him into one of the most sought-after young journalists in Washington D.C., but a bizarre chain of events suddenly stopped his careers path. Nominated for four Independent Spirit Awards and a Golden Globe(n)

programme.title: Fido
programme.desc: In a 1950s-era alternate universe where domesticated zombies play a functional role in society by delivering the milk, carrying the mail, and even helping out with household chores, one boy is about to find out just how big of a personal responsibility "pet" ownership truly is. When the Earth passed through a cloud of space dust and the dead arose from their graves to devour the flesh of the living, it first seemed that all hope for humanity was lost. Society's rapid slide into chaos, however, was soon halted when scientists at a company called ZomCom created a special collar that turned the rampaging animated corpses docile. Now, thanks to ZomCom, everything is under control -- or is it? Timmy Robinson (K'Sun Ray) isn't quite convinced. Quiet and withdrawn, the skeptical young boy spends so much time locked away in his room that he's almost become invisible around the household. His mother Helen (Carrie-Anne Moss) has recently purchased a zombie to help keep things tidy around the house though, and when the creature attempts to engage the curious youngster in a game of catch, a friendship is forged between boy and zombie that finds the amiable gut-muncher nicknamed Fido (Billy Connolly) practically becoming a part of the family. Things take a turn for the worse however, when Fido's collar malfunctions and Timmy's neighbors begin dying in droves. When ZomCom's top zombie control specialist Mr. Bottoms (Henry Czerny) moves in across the street from Timmy, the increasingly complicated situation threatens to place a serious stumbling block in the path of human-zombie relations(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Director Peter Weir's first turn behind the camera since 1998's critically acclaimed The Truman Show, Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World is based on two Napoleonic War-era adventure novels in author Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, Master and Commander and The Far Side of the World. Russell Crowe stars as Captain Jack Aubrey, a high-seas adventurer who maintains a strong bond with ship-surgeon Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany). After conquering much of Europe already, Napoleon's forces have set their sights on taking Britain, so Aubrey and the crew of his ship, the HMS Surprise, take to the Pacific to intercept any attacking ships from the French fleet. When Aubrey eyes a renegade French super-frigate, the Surprise pursues, leading to an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea. Edward Woodall, James D'Arcy, and Lee Ingleby also star as members of the Surprise's crew(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Explorer Rick O'Connell and his wife Evelyn are asked by the British government to take a magical diamond back to China. Unfortunately the jewel has the power to resurrect the evil Emperor Han, who long ago was transformed into a mummy along with his cut-throat army of soldiers. Soon the race is on to prevent Han from returning to life and taking over the world(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: In this thrilling and inspirational sci-fi drama, a lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: An Iraq War veteran returns home after a firefight which left him in a coma and took the lives of several civilians. Soon after arriving, he is wracked with guilt and plagued by dreams of a burning man who wants something from him. After being denied treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder, he enlists the help of a psychic to help him understand, and hopefully conquer, his terrifying visions(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Night Watch director Timur Bekmambetov helms his first English-language feature film with this big-screen adaptation of Mark Millar's action-packed graphic novel. Wesley Gibson (James McAvoy) is a cube-dwelling hypochondriac whose uneventful life has become a mundane blur of terminal boredom. Repeatedly humiliated by his boss and constantly cuckolded by his cheating girlfriend, weakling Wes seems to be living right down to everyone's expectations that he would never amount to anything in life. However, upon discovering that the father he never knew has been brutally murdered, the spineless, clock-punching pushover is recruited into a secret society of assassins known as the Fraternity. During the course of his training, the man who was once an office-bound wimp develops lightning-fast reflexes and superhuman dexterity courtesy of his skilled mentor Fox (Angelina Jolie). Upon completing his training, Wes is assigned the task of dealing out death to the mythological Fates, who possess the ability to alter the lifelines of mortal men. It isn't long before the nebbish nerd-turned-agile assassin is erasing the bad guys with surprising efficiency, yet as Wes begins to carry the mantle passed down to him by his father, he gradually begins to suspect that his wise tutors are not the crime-fighting enforcers they present themselves to be. Now, with everything he ever wanted in life finally within his grasp, Wes is about to find out that the only thing more difficult than ending the lives of others is summoning the courage to take control of his own(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: A macho cop goes undercover as a schoolteacher as part of his efforts to prosecute an elusive drug dealer, but quickly finds out he's no match for a roomful of feisty 6-year-olds(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In the future, criminals are arrested before they have even committed their crime, thanks to the forecasting of 'pre-cogs'. Detective John Anderton thinks the system is perfect... until he's arrested. Brilliant sci-fi thriller based on a story by Philip K Dick(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An FBI agent goes undercover and infiltrates a group of extreme athletes in order to prove they are using their specialised skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. The film is inspired by the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Half Past Dead
programme.desc: After infiltrating a crime syndicate, an undercover FBI agent lands in prison, where he tries to thwart a plot to recover stolen gold(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Agnes is running away from her ex boyfriend with her new boyfriend Peter. Peter is also on the run from the military - and bugs that he believes is going to take over his body. Together they seek shelter at a small motel. Soon Agnes also sees the bugs' crawling up from every corner witch is the start for a joint battle against the bugs. Slowly paranoia and fear takes over and threatens to destroy them both mentally and physically(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: After radiation from a comet showers the earth, inanimate tractor-trailers come to life and terrorize a group of people trapped in a rest stop. The manager (Pat Hingle) and a prisoner on parole (Emilio Estevez) organize the defense of the group and engage a counter-attack(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Una expedición regresa de Marte y desconoce que transporta un alien que durante el trayecto invalida el ADN de sus tripulantes. Una vez en la Tierra, y tras un exhaustivo reconocimiento médico, se prohibe que los viajeros mantengan relaciones sexuales, pe(n)

programme.title: Sudden Impact
programme.desc: While on a forced holiday due to his feud with a local crime lord, a San Francisco police detective becomes involved with a rape victim who has become a lethal vigilante(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: In this film adaptation of the classic video-game, humans must protect their peaceful realm of Azeroth from the invading Orc Warriors(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Eerie saga about a rare-book buyer who becomes a target of unknown forces when he's asked to find a volume about the Devil(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: BBC radio presenter Fearne Cotton joins Michel Roux Jr, as chefs Sabrina Ghayour and Lawrence Keogh prepare dishes for her to sample in the studio kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge is in her own kitchen to give step-by-step instructions for recipes for everyday meals and special occasions. She begins with advice on how to host a traditional tea party, sharing a clever trick for making sandwiches in advance and baking bite-sized scones for a cream tea, while her grand-daughters help her make orange butterfly cakes. Mary also visits a plantation in Cornwall to find out how tea is grown.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A pair of nurses takes on a duo of paramedics in Derby, with the assistance of antiques experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt. Meanwhile, Tim Wonnacott finds an archaic system of communication at the fair, before visiting the V&A Museum of Childhood in London.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Golden Gala Pietro Mennea. Gabby Logan presents action from the fourth Diamond League event of the season, which was held at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple looking to buy their first home together in rural Staffordshire on a budget of £700,000, and also learns about the county's influence on agriculture and architecture.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths hidden gems at a recycling centre in Witley, Surrey, including a rusty petrol can and an old chest of drawers.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the quiz featuring famous names from the world of TV wildlife programmes. Taking part are Chris Packham and Martin Hughes-Games, Tom Heap and Jules Hudson, Miranda Krestovnikoff and Paul Heiney, and Naomi Wilkinson and Bill Oddie.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist, with his young sidekick and a nightclub singer in tow, is stranded in India, where he takes on a mission to recover magical sacred stones from the hands of an evil cult engaged in human sacrifice and child slavery. Steven Spielberg's action adventure, starring Harrison Ford, Kate Capshaw, Ke Huy Quan and Amrish Puri.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Time Lord, Bill and Nardole find themselves on Mars, but despite removing themselves from Earth, they still end up embroiled in yet another stand-off between humanity and alien forces. This time, though, mankind has become the aggressor. In a bid to extend their queen's empire into space, Victorian soldiers have somehow invaded the red planet, and their activities threaten to awaken a hive of militant Ice Warriors, for whom Mars is home. As tensions escalate, the Doctor faces a unique dilemma. He has vowed to serve humanity as its protector, but when it is the humans who are the invaders, whose side should he take? Sci-fi drama, starring Peter Capaldi, Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges two pairs of complete strangers to team up, with pair each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Violence at a right-wing rally outside a local Muslim community centre brings plenty of patients in to Holby's ER, including Mickey, who Jez is dismayed to learn has still been supporting his racist family. Ethan discovers Scott Ellisson has been released from police custody without charge, and when he turns up at the hospital alongside his injured brother, Ethan spots a chance to confront him about Cal's death. Meanwhile, Iain worries Lily is overdoing it as she prepares for her consultancy exams, and Duffy tries to help Charlie process his grief, as he ignores his own emotions in an attempt to help his colleagues deal with Cal's untimely demise.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes goes on a diet after her family's comments about her weight, but soon realises how difficult it will be to lay off the fish and chips. Cathy's new partner seems more interested in her mother when he visits the Brown household, and Rory has a professional dilemma after he discovers illegal drugs at work.(n)

programme.title: Would I Lie to You
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs divulge what sound like tall tales about themselves, before their rival contestants decide whether they are lying. Greg Davies takes Lee Mack's place as guest captain, and joining him and David Mitchell are choir leader Gareth Malone, Sherlock actress Amanda Abbington, comedian and Buzzcocks panellist Phill Jupitus and Pointless co-host Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: A 19th-century imperial guard to the Emperor of China faces a clash of cultures when he is flung into the Wild West on a mission to rescue a princess who has been kidnapped by a renegade. In a bid to complete his quest, he teams up with a bumbling outlaw. Comedy Western, starring Jackie Chan, Owen Wilson, Jason Connery and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: A round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs and a round-up of the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned, including a mid-terrace house near Birmingham, a flat in Maida Hill, west London, and a plot of land in Fife's historic Dunfermline. Later they meet the new owners and discuss their plans for the purchases, before checking back on their progress.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A pair of sisters and two students select antiques to take to auction in Newark, Nottinghamshire, helped by experts Richard Madley and Catherine Southon. Tim Wonnacott presents.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Greg and Jenni Wallen spend a trial week living in Auckland, New Zealand, with Greg keen to return to the country he fell in love with while backpacking.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore's recycling mission takes her to Altrincham, Greater Manchester, where wallpaper designer Daniel Heath must use all his creativity to transform a set of rusty railings.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A look at some of the best finds by experts Thomas Plant, Adam Partridge, James Lewis, Mark Stacey and others during the programme's visits to Edinburgh, Wallasey, Southwell and Dunster Castle. Items featured include a collection of war medals and a unique funeral invitation. Plus, Paul Martin takes a tour of the Library of Birmingham and discovers what it has brought to the city.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cornwall to help a woman with a passion for horses search for a rural respite with a budget of £465,000. Away from the hunt, he meets a boat builder.(n)

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine presents a selection of viewers' comments on BBC shows, a chance to see memorable clips, and an insight into what goes on behind the scenes of new programmes.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Radio 2 DJ Johnnie Walker and his wife Tiggy discuss caring for a partner battling cancer. Plus, an introduction to the soldiers preparing for this year's Trooping the Colour.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Rielly family lower their food bills, showing them simple and effective ways to save money on their weekly food shop. The pair have a challenge on their hands as each member of the busy family have very different eating habits, meaning mum Stacy cooks 3 different dinners every night, including meals for her son Harry, who has Type 1 diabetes.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The rural current affairs series visits Northern Ireland, where Joe Crowley heads into the woods near Belfast to help members of the RSPB tag swifts. He also tours a farm where physalis, mustard flowers and Asian radishes are found growing alongside the usual fare of potatoes, carrots and cauliflowers. Ellie Harrison takes in sites associated with St Patrick on Church Island, and Adam Henson finds out why herdwick sheep are being used to graze on ground where some of the UK's rarest plants are found.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a second show from New Lanark on the banks of the Clyde, where items brought in to be valued include diamonds that were found after being hidden inside an upholstered chair, a claret jug that was rescued from a pawn shop, and a banner for Britain's oldest subscription library, founded in 1741.(n)

programme.title: Poldark
programme.desc: New series. The popular period drama based on the novels of Winston Graham returns. The year is 1794, and Ross Poldark throws himself into the business of repairing Nampara, and rebuilding his relationship with Demelza. However, Elizabeth's pregnancy continues to cast a shadow over the pair's marriage. Young Geoffrey Charles is placed in the care of a new governess, and he and Poldark bond over their shared hatred of George. Meanwhile, Demelza visits her dying father at the behest of her brothers, who have taken up Methodism, and Elizabeth places both her own life and that of her unborn child in danger when she tries to hide the fact that she has gone into labour early. Starring Aidan Turner, Eleanor Tomlinson and Heida Reed.(n)

programme.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier becomes an operative for secret intelligence agency SHIELD, but grows suspicious of their motives. Following a battle with a mysterious cyborg assassin, he and fellow Avenger Black Widow become fugitives, and try to bring down a sinister conspiracy. Comic-book thriller sequel, starring Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Samuel L Jackson and Robert Redford.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter P, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Dance, Girl, Dance
programme.desc: An aspiring dancer goes to New York hoping to become a ballerina, but the only work she can get is as a sidekick to a burlesque performer. Their already awkward working relationship falls apart completely when both women fall in love with a wealthy playboy. Musical comedy, with Maureen O'Hara, Lucille Ball and Louis Hayward.(n)

programme.title: The Westerner
programme.desc: A wandering cowboy gets mixed up in a range war between cattlemen and homesteaders in 1880s Texas, antagonising the notorious Judge Roy Bean in the process. He manages to escape the death sentence thanks to a quick-witted con - but is forced to take drastic action to bring the lawman's tyranny to an end. Western, starring Gary Cooper and an Oscar-winning Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Mark Horton explores the history of the Holy Island of Lindisfarne. He relives the first Viking raid in June 793AD and discovers how the marauding Norsemen galvanised the warring Anglo-Saxon kingdoms to form the English nation.(n)

programme.title: Monty Halls' Great Hebridean Escape
programme.desc: The marine biologist tries to raise funds to publish his research on walking trails and enlists the help of artist Steve Burgess. As Christmas approaches, he takes ceilidh lessons and indulges in a bit of wildlife watching, before celebrating the festive season with a dip in the sea and dinner with friends, and learning that the local ranger committee has decided to take on board his recommendations to employ a permanent ranger. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander meets a World Cup rugby player developing a house in Streatham, London, and Martin Roberts looks round a house in Newport, Shropshire and meets a young developer who has bought a terraced house in Cwmfelinfach, Wales - the ninth property he has worked on so far.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales prepare starters, with returning chef Phil Carmichael taking on newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie. The three chefs all create complex dishes, with both Paul and Phil championing the tomato, while Nick hopes his rabbit and carrot dish will give him the edge over the other two.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops. Meanwhile, Phil Carmichael and Nick Brodie are both preparing meals using mackerel which hope they can elevate for the exacting standards of the All England Club.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales, returning chef Phil Carmichael and newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie, go all out to impress with their main courses. Each chef uses Welsh lamb as the centrepiece of their dish, showcasing a range of techniques and using an array of unusual ingredients to elevate their main courses to banquet level.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profiles of stars of the silver screen, beginning with actress Bette Davis, whose Hollywood career took off with the fledgling film production company Warner Brothers in 1932. The programme includes her television appearances made over the years, and captures the milestones and highlights of her fame, including her role in horror movie What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? in which she co-starred with Joan Crawford as a former child star caring for her disabled sister. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Now, Voyager
programme.desc: A nervous and frustrated spinster undergoes psychiatric treatment and emerges transformed. Despite her new-found happiness and optimistic outlook on life, she finds that beauty and confidence can bring their own share of heartache. Romantic drama, starring Bette Davis, Paul Henreid, Claude Rains, Gladys Cooper and Bonita Granville.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Experts James Braxton and Helen Hall conclude their road trip, beginning in Hampstead, north-west London, before stopping off in Brighton, East Sussex, en route to an auction in Lewes. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift, Carol Klein and Adam Frost take an exclusive look at the new RHS Chatsworth Flower Show, meeting designer Jo Thompson as she prepares her show garden with a difference. In the Floral Pavilion, Carol finds pioneering plants that have shaped the gardens of today, while garden designer Arit Anderson looks to the future - meeting the team behind a garden built for the changing climate. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring enlists an unusual recruit to the platoon - a tracker dog provided by Walker. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring John Le Mesurier, Arthur Lowe and Clive Dunn.(n)

programme.title: The Royal Academy Summer Exhibition
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark and Brenda Emmanus tour the Royal Academy galleries during a glamorous private preview of this year's Summer Exhibition, which is due to open to the public on Tuesday. The exhibition sees established British artists displaying work alongside that of less well-known contemporaries, and here, Kirsty and Brenda go behind the scenes of the event in the run-up to the grand opening. The pair meet some of the featured artists, and explore the process of curating the world's largest open-submission exhibition.(n)

programme.title: Live International Rugby Union
programme.desc: Argentina v England (Kick-off 8.15pm). Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the opening match of the two-Test series, staged at the Estadio San Juan del Bicentenario in San Juan. This tour represents a chance for several players to stake a claim to a regular place in Eddie Jones' squad, with England missing their leading stars to the Lions' tour of New Zealand. With commentary by Eddie Butler and Andy Robinson, and analysis by Clive Woodward and Jeremy Guscott.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the Group A clash in the final round of pool-stage fixtures, which took place at Edgbaston.(n)

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Resolutions are tested as Louis XIV returns to Versailles vowing to purify his private life, while Madame de Montespan hopes to cement her place in his heart. The feelings of Philippe for Chevalier are rocked by an unexpected depth of concern for Princess Palatine, who shows symptoms of possible poisoning. Meanwhile, Fabien Marchal faces a personal appeal to review his refusal to return. George Blagden, Anna Brewster, Alexander Vlahos, Evan Williams, Jessica Clark and Tygh Runyan star in the sumptuous period drama.(n)

programme.title: Elles
programme.desc: While doing research for a magazine article, a journalist plans to shadow two students working as prostitutes. She becomes more heavily involved in the lives of the women, and begins to explore her own sexual desires and outlook on life. Drama, starring Juliette Binoche, Anais Demoustier and Joanna Kulig. In French, English and Polish.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift, Carol Klein and Adam Frost take an exclusive look at the new RHS Chatsworth Flower Show, meeting designer Jo Thompson as she prepares her show garden with a difference. In the Floral Pavilion, Carol finds pioneering plants that have shaped the gardens of today, while garden designer Arit Anderson looks to the future - meeting the team behind a garden built for the changing climate. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and George Anderson don their waders to clear the blanketweed from the pond, and Jim McColl also wages war on his weeds - using a flamethrower. George joins Brian Cunningham to create a sky effect alpine wall using blue and white plants, and Carole visits a garden in a quarry at Blebo Craigs near Strathkinness, Fife.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Ellie Harrison report from Essex, visiting a restored oyster boat, a nature reserve for dragonflies, and a colony of common seals, and meeting people who build racing rowing boats. Steve Brown learns to fire a medieval longbow, Tom Heap reports on environmental damage caused by spoil heaps, and Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith meet a contender for Countryfile's Young Farmer Award.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents a moral and religious discussion from Harris Academy, Peckham, on the subject of whether interfering with genes is ethical.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Venezuela v England (Kick-off 11.00am). Mark Chapman presents coverage of the final, held at Suwon World Cup Stadium in South Korea, as England look to win their first World Cup at any level of football since 1966. With analysis from Danny Mills and Trevor Sinclair, and commentary by Guy Mowbray.(n)

programme.title: Live Triathlon
programme.desc: Ore Oduba presents coverage of the men's and women's elite races in the fourth round of the ITU World Series from Leeds. Much of the focus, as always, will be on Alistair and Jonny Brownlee in the men's race, with Jonny looking to recover from his bike crash last time out in Yokohama, and Alistair making his first World Series appearance of the season. The women's race also features British contenders, in former world champion Non Stanford and Olympic medallist Vicky Holland.(n)

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: Engineer Linda Miller battles to rebuild a Victorian tunnel under the Royal Docks in the East End as part of the Crossrail train line linking east and west London. Meanwhile, the Berminghams attempt to follow in the footsteps of 19th-century father-and-son team Marc and Isambard Kingdom Brunel as they construct a new tunnel beneath the Thames.(n)

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Evan Davis presents the show as more entrepreneurs try to impress the panel. Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sarah Willingham and Nick Jenkins cast their eyes over an innovative tool and a portable water-saving device. However, a restaurateur struggles to get across the details of his business plan.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A hunter from the Amazon rainforest trades places with a civil servant in London, as the adventure travelogue continues. Guyanese Lionel, who has lived as part of the self-sustaining Machousi tribe, learns that a life of comfort in the British capital comes at a cost that many are unable to afford, and plans to communicate this to his city-obsessed children back home. Meanwhile, civil servant John discovers the essential value of community as he visits Lionel's village Surama, where the arrival of money and capitalism threaten to end a way of life that has survived for centuries.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: The Bake Off judge concludes his trip in France, as he tries to find out what makes the country tick when it comes to cars. Paul's six-day road trip begins in Paris, where he is joined for the day by the host of French Top Gear, Philippe Lellouche. In a classic Citroen DS, they set off through the rain and experience the joys of Parisian traffic jams and the mayhem which is the roundabout around the Arc de Triomphe. The final day sees Paul travel to Magny-Cours racing circuit to meet two Formula 1 legends and Jean Pierre Jabouille, the man who drove the first F1 turbo car. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: New series. Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: When Vincent receives a visit from a tax inspector, pursuing him for unpaid tax, he decides that now would be a good time to get out of the showroom and spend some more time with his family. They take a trip to Southend, but it does not go exactly as they planned. Meanwhile, Fitzpatrick and Lavender clash over the ethics of Page 3 when a competition in The Sun newspaper arises, and Vincent's side-business, pirating copies on E.T on VHS in the backroom of the showroom, continues to roll out in his absence.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: India v South Africa. Action from the Group B encounter at the Oval, as the one-day competition continued.(n)

programme.title: Sailing
programme.desc: Shirley Robertson presents action from the opening day of the challenger play-off finals in Bermuda, as the teams competed for the right to face reigning champions Oracle Team USA.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough chooses the 10 endangered animals from around the world that he would most like to save from extinction, explaining why these creatures are so important and highlighting the work of biologists helping to keep them alive. His list includes Darwin's frog, the Sumatran rhino, Priam's birdwing butterfly and the black lion tamarin.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes the annual surge of more than 100 million sardines along South Africa's east coast as inshore waters cool with the arrival of winter. This marine spectacle provides a feast for competing predators including dolphins, whales, sharks and seabirds, but the sardine run has become less predictable in recent years - posing a threat to the creatures that depend on it to survive.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: Delorme worries that Cardinal might be on to her, and digs deeper into the reasons behind her secret investigation. Meanwhile, a killer couple stalk the streets seeking a victim. Canadian crime thriller, starring Billy Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Cardinal
programme.desc: A small-time thief gets caught up in Eric and Edie's sadistic world when he breaks into their cellar dungeon, and finds Keith. Meanwhile, Cardinal and Delorme's personal conflict threatens their new partnership. Canadian crime thriller, starring Billy Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen host the 20th anniversary edition of the music show, first broadcast on January 5, 1984, featuring Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Rod Stewart, Status Quo, Frank Kelly, Slade and the Flying Pickets, as well as archive footage of artists to have appeared over the years.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright introduce performances by the Icicle Works, Howard Jones, Shakin' Stevens and Bonnie Tyler, Roland Rat, Snowy White, Lionel Richie, Joe Fagin and Paul McCartney.(n)

programme.title: Metal at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable heavy-metal performances from BBC shows, including Iron Maiden, Black Sabbath, Judas Priest and Motorhead.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Most Dangerous Songs: Listen to the Banned
programme.desc: The stories of 10 songs, dating from the 1930s to the present day, that were considered unsuitable by the BBC for broadcasting on its radio and television stations. Tunes include My Little Stick of Blackpool Rock by George Formby to the Sex Pistols' God Save the Queen, though it is perhaps surprising that Bing Crosby and the Munchkins are among the other performers on the list. The reasons why these records were censored reveals much of the changing controversies around youth culture. Contributors include Carrie Grant, Paul Morley, Stuart Maconie, Glen Matlock, Mike Read and Jon Robb.(n)

programme.title: More Dangerous Songs: And the Banned Played On
programme.desc: A compilation of songs previously banned from broadcast on the BBC, including the Kinks' Lola, Jackie by Scott Walker, and (We Don't Need This) Fascist Groove Thing by Heaven 17.(n)

programme.title: Meat Loaf: In and Out of Hell
programme.desc: A profile of the rock star's life and career, reflecting on the music that propelled him to fame and charting his journey from an overweight, bullied child to his larger-than-life persona and icon status. Featuring an interview and performance by the singer, as well as backstage footage from a Las Vegas concert. The film also revisits the Dallas of Meat Loaf's early years and includes insights from high school friends who reveal where the unusual moniker really came from.(n)

programme.title: Metal at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of memorable heavy-metal performances from BBC shows, including Iron Maiden, Black Sabbath, Judas Priest and Motorhead.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Life Is Sweets
programme.desc: The food writer charts the origins of British sweets and chocolate, from medicinal medieval boiled candy to the treats that line supermarket shelves today. Nigel recalls his favourites from childhood, including a small toffee that inspired him to write his memoir, marshmallows that remind him of his mother and a travel sweet which conjures up visions of his father.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Motorway
programme.desc: How public opinion about Britain's motorways has changed since the first stretch was opened in 1958 to little opposition. The documentary explores the reaction to a plan for an elevated ring road through the heart of London and recalls the government's Roads for Prosperity project in the 1980s - scrapped after protests against the Twyford Down scheme gained significant media coverage. Philip Glenister narrates.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Secrets of the Solar System.
programme.desc: Planets are now being discovered outside Earth's solar system on a regular basis, and these strange new worlds are forcing scientists to rewrite the history of how the Sun and the planets, satellites, dwarf planets, asteroids and comets that orbit it came into being. This programme reveals that far from a simple story of stable objects orbiting a star, the development of the solar system was a potent combination of hellfire, chaos and planetary pinball that makes it somewhat of a miracle that Earth was created at all.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.sub-title: Inside God's Observatory: A Sky at Night Special.
programme.desc: A special programme from the Vatican's observatory, the Specola Vaticana, where Maggie Aderin-Pocock and Chris Lintott explore its history and contemporary cutting-edge science.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Star Men: Heroes of Astronomy
programme.desc: Four veteran British stargazers go on a road trip to celebrate 50 years of work and friendship, which represents a highly productive period in astronomy. Now in their 70s, they share their reflections on a life spent looking at the universe as they journey through the south-western United States, revisiting the places where they worked and the landscape they explored together as young men.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox takes a journey through the BBC science archive to explore the story of mankind's relationship with the moon, from James Burke testing Nasa equipment to Neil Armstrong's first steps on the lunar surface and the dramatic tale of Apollo 13. He also asks whether international competition could help reignite the public's enthusiasm for space travel and bring about the dawn of a new space age.(n)

programme.title: The Ugly Truth
programme.desc: Katherine Heigl and Gerard Butler star in this sexually unsophisticated romcom from writer/ director Robert Luketic. When a TV morning show's ratings fail to impress the suits, its producer Abby Richter finds herself having to welcome a new, and hopefully ratings-boosting, host, Mike Chadaway. Trouble is, she's a control-freak perfectionist, while he's the chauvinistic former host of a freewheeling late-night chat show, who's used to living in the moment. The two are destined from the start not to get along. And so it proves. But when Abby falls for an attractive doctor, she takes the questionable decision to follow Mike's dating advice. Cue a succession of crude and, for Abby, humiliating set-pieces as she aims to snag her man..(n)

programme.desc: Gibbs and the team attend the funeral of a fallen colleague before resuming their hunt for the man they believe to be the port-to-port killer. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy lieutenant Paul Booth is shot dead while sitting on a park bench. It turns out that the last people he called were his boss, his wife and Penelope Langston - a rebellious academic who also happens to be McGee's grandmother. She says that the victim was an old student of hers who kept in touch, but later reveals she was recruited to work on a special project during the Vietnam War by the head of a top-secret think tank Booth was a member of. Guest starring Lily Tomlin, with Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
