programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy, with sketches including Done to Death. Plus, music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy, with sketches including News Items and Done to Death. Plus, music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Speckled Band.
programme.desc: Victor and Margaret prepare for a holiday in Athens - but their preparations are delayed by an unhelpful electricity board representative, as well as an escaped snake. Starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie, with a guest appearance by Clive Mantle.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Genuine Outdoors Robin Hood Barbi.
programme.desc: Billy promises the gang a perfect barbecue in the great outdoors - without a newfangled portable contraption - and takes Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle into the Dales. He knows the ideal spot - if he can just remember how to find it. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry in Danger from Reading and Aunt Jessie.
programme.desc: Nora Batty spots Alvin with a mystery woman, and convinces herself that the couple are becoming close after some devious work by the elderly Lothario and a blushing Billy. Pearl spots a lonely hearts advertisement that she is sure is from Howard. Kathy Staff, Brian Murphy and Keith Clifford star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Merry Man with Billy, Then?.
programme.desc: After recruitment for his Merry Men hits an all-time low, a letter from an enthusiast with excellent credentials gets Billy excited again, and he organises a committee to greet the newest member. Long-running comedy, starring Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy, with sketches including Done to Death. Plus, music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney leaves home after a fight with Cassandra, and arranges a date with receptionist Tanya in an effort to make his wife jealous - but Del's interference ensures the plan fails to go as smoothly as it should. Christmas special first shown in 1990, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del and Rodney's Christmas celebrations are disrupted by the unexpected arrival of their estranged father - leaving the brothers doubtful they can trust him after such a long absence. Another chance to see the 1983 festive special of John Sullivan's comedy.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del pays a stripper to attend a party at the Nag's Head with Rodney, who has been bet by Mickey Pearce that he cannot find a date for the occasion. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Comedy featuring a British Pakistani family, set in Sparkhill, Birmingham. Plans for daughter Shazia's forthcoming wedding to Amjad are thrown into disarray when Mr Khan forgets to book a venue, much to his wife's displeasure. The self-opinionated patriarch isn't too concerned though, he's confident that he can persuade mosque manager Dave to do him a favour - but his long-suffering nearest and dearest know from experience that nothing is ever straightforward when father's involved. Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia star, with Kris Marshall and Abdullah Afzal.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan's mother comes to stay, jeopardising Mr Khan's big opportunity to hob-nob with the bigwigs of Sparkhill Business Association when he has to take the old woman on a shopping trip. Comedy about the trials and tribulations of a British Pakistani family, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor, Maya Sondhi and Bhavna Limbachia.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan fancies a holiday, but Mr Khan refuses to dip into the couple's `rainy day' fund - especially when they still have daughter Shazia's honeymoon to pay for. However, a meeting at the local mosque provides an unusual solution. Comedy, starring Adil Ray, Shobu Kapoor and Maya Sondhi.(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: Manny's parents come to stay, and Bernard strives to get rid of them, while Fran has her own reasons for wanting them to leave. It soon becomes clear that Manny may not have been completely honest about his achievements. Comedy, guest starring Annette Crosbie (One Foot in the Grave) and Sam Kelly ('Allo 'Allo!).(n)

programme.title: Black Books
programme.desc: As if smoking and drinking heavily were not bad enough, a bet on the Grand National sends Bernard spiralling into yet another addiction - gambling. As his ailing finances suffer the consequences of his latest vice, he decides it is time to actually sell some books - but it may be too late. Guest starring Keith Allen, with Dylan Moran and Tamsin Greig.(n)

programme.title: Monty Python: Live at Aspen
programme.desc: Reunion show from 1998 featuring surviving Pythons John Cleese, Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Michael Palin, and an urn allegedly containing the ashes of Graham Chapman. The Pythons look back at their work, discuss the effect their work has had on subsequent comedy shows and receive an American Film Industry award. Hosted by Robert Klein and featuring a cameo appearance by Eddie Izzard.(n)

programme.title: Steve Coogan as Alan Partridge and Other Less Successful Characters
programme.desc: The actor performs at the Blackpool Opera House in 2008, as part of a national tour showcasing a selection of his many comic creations, including Paul and Pauline Calf, Tommy Saxondale, Duncan Thickett and Alan Partridge.(n)

programme.desc: Rodney aspires to be a pop star, taking on the role of the drumless drummer in Mental Mickey's band but, not surprisingly, Del-Boy manages to ruin his chances. With a guest appearance by DJ Mike Read, alongside David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.desc: The Trotters agree to dog-sit while Boycie and Marlene go on holiday, and happily tuck into the fresh meat lovingly provided for their charge, scarcely suspecting what lies ahead. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan meddles in the local mosque's attempts to find a new call to prayer, becoming the Simon Cowell of Sparkhill with his own X Factor-style auditions. Family duty also calls when he is asked to sort out his future son-in-law Amjad's promotion. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mr Khan's new plasma TV gives him the perfect opportunity to invite his friends round to enjoy the Pakistan versus England cricket match. The only problem is, Mrs Khan plans to host a prayer meeting for her recently widowed friend, and needs complete calm in the house. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: The family has a spare invitation for the wedding, so Mrs Khan suggests giving it to the Parvez family. But her husband thinks the fewer guests the better and would rather have the influential Councillor Javed at the celebration. The decision is not an easy one to make - and to complicate matters, today just happens to be his own anniversary. Sitcom, starring Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan's plan to watch all the James Bond films over the Bank Holiday weekend with Michael fall apart when his pal deserts him for the local American Truckfest - forcing him to decide whether to make a new friend or accompany Lynn to visit her mother's grave. Starring Steve Coogan and Felicity Montagu.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.sub-title: I Know What Alan Did Last Summer.
programme.desc: Alan fears a visit from the Inland Revenue may be imminent, while Sonja discovers he has lied about his close ties with rock star Bono. Steve Coogan and Amelia Bullmore star.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finalists really have their imaginations put to the test this evening as John Torode and Gregg Wallace ask them to rustle up a dish using scraps, trimmings and leftovers. The ingredients include chicken giblets and skin, bones, pigs' ears, fish heads and bones, potato peelings and stale bread, so they need to use their ingenuity as well as their skill - and for one, it'll be the last dish they ever make on MasterChef. The rest are left to prepare a six-course menu for an esteemed group of experts who make their living analysing food and drink - so they won't be easy to please.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough week of semi-finals, the best six amateur cooks remain, but there are only five places in next week's finals. Now they face the last challenge to decide who will go through - a single showstopping dish to win over three of the country's leading restaurant critics, Tracey MacLeod, William Sitwell and Charles Campion. At the end of the service, it's down to John Torode and Gregg Wallace to decide who deserves a place in the final.(n)

programme.title: Two Fat Ladies
programme.desc: Chefs Clarissa Dickson Wright and Jennifer Paterson come to the aid of hungry priests at Westminster Cathedral by preparing a range of dishes using fruit and vegetables, including traditional bubble and squeak, hot stuffed artichokes and tomato summer pudding.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: Keith visits Santa Fe, where he cooks pork and black beans for the local cowboys, before dining at a tapas restaurant where the waiters sing opera. He also takes part in a chilli cook-off and visits a tapas restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: The chef travels to Austin, Texas, where he visits the ranch of Larry and Shelly Beard to cook a steak with hot sauce and makes the perfect margarita. He also goes to the Big Wheel restaurant, where breakfast is prepared for truckers, and cooks chicken fajitas.(n)

programme.title: Floyd's American Pie
programme.desc: The chef visits the Sonoma Valley and San Francisco in California, for a rendezvous at Alioto's Restaurant in the fisherman's wharf to cook a Sicilian dish and meet owner Nuncio Alioto. He heads on to the Ironhouse vineyard for a display of local produce, and serves up a meal for one of the owners, Forrect Tancer, before dropping into Chinatown for a guided tour with Shirley Fong-Torres.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd is off to Cornwall to visit a field kitchen at HMS Raleigh, the new-entry training establishment for all ratings joining the Royal Navy.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Keith Floyd prepares chicken with peppers and cream for the crew of a French trawler in Newlyn, Cornwall, and rustles up pork Normande for the owner of a pig farm. The chef also meets the man in charge of the Cornish Smoked Fish Co in Chatlestown.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Food
programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd visits Enzo Mauro at his restaurant in Newbridge, Penzance, where he also talks to Nick Howells about salted pilchards. He then heads to Botallack Count House to cook rabbit, and spends time cooking shark steak in pinquant tomato sauce with Rick Stein at the Seafood Restaurant in Padstow.(n)

programme.desc: Keith Floyd cooks boeuf en daube and pollacks in green pepper sauce at the home of Trish Norris in Newquay.(n)

programme.desc: Fact-based film about a relentless serial killer stalking the streets of the San Francisco Bay Area in the 1970s, leaving citizens locked into a constant state of panic and baffled authorities scrambling for clues. programme.title: Donnie Brasco
programme.desc: Drama based on the true story of an ageing hit man who takes a young gangster under his wing, unaware that he is actually an FBI agent. Small-time mobster Lefty Ruggiero regrets the fact he has never made it into the big league, so when he meets promising new recruit Donnie Brasco, he invests his unfulfilled dreams in his new protege. What Lefty does not know is that Donnie has an alternative agenda(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: A young outcast from a primitive tribe is forced to defend his people from a brutal onslaught in Independence Day director Roland Emmerich's fast-paced period adventure. Despite the fact that he is low man on the totem pole in his tribe of fearless hunters, a brave young boy (Steven Strait) longs to win the heart of a beautiful princess (Camilla Belle) who is well above his station in life. When an overwhelming horde of powerful invaders forces the hunters into slavery and abducts the princess, the once-aimless boy suddenly finds his destiny taking an unexpected turn. Now, if he has any hope of saving his tribe from certain extinction, this young boy will have to fight for the future to his dying breath(n)

programme.desc: Paul Newman racked up an Oscar reprising his role from "The Hustler", a pool shark who takes a hotshot under his wing(n)

programme.title: The Cider House Rules
programme.desc: Homer Wells is an orphan who spent most of his childhood at the St. Cloud Orphanage in rural Maine, where he grew up under the strong but affectionate care of Dr. Wilbur Larch. Larch has passed along his medical education to Homer, and the young man helps the doctor care for abandoned children and the newborn babies of unwed mothers; however, Homer refuses to assist Larch with illegal abortions performed on the side(n)

programme.title: Joe Kidd
programme.desc: Old-fashioned western in which a bounty hunter joins a posse hunting a band of aggrieved Mexican Americans fighting for their land in turn-of-the-century New Mexico. Cheated by corrupt bureaucracy, the Mexicans rebel, provoking a powerful landowner to round up a team of gunmen to capture them. The bounty hunter, after an initially neutral stance, joins them, but soon does things his own way(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Jovovich and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: A young outcast from a primitive tribe is forced to defend his people from a brutal onslaught in Independence Day director Roland Emmerich's fast-paced period adventure. Despite the fact that he is low man on the totem pole in his tribe of fearless hunters, a brave young boy (Steven Strait) longs to win the heart of a beautiful princess (Camilla Belle) who is well above his station in life. When an overwhelming horde of powerful invaders forces the hunters into slavery and abducts the princess, the once-aimless boy suddenly finds his destiny taking an unexpected turn. Now, if he has any hope of saving his tribe from certain extinction, this young boy will have to fight for the future to his dying breath(n)

Larch has passed along his medical education to Homer, and the young man helps the doctor care for abandoned children and the newborn babies of unwed mothers; however, Homer refuses to assist Larch with illegal abortions performed on the side(n)

programme.title: Joe Kidd
programme.desc: Old-fashioned western in which a bounty hunter joins a posse hunting a band of aggrieved Mexican Americans fighting for their land in turn-of-the-century New Mexico. Cheated by corrupt bureaucracy, the Mexicans rebel, provoking a powerful landowner to round up a team of gunmen to capture them. The bounty hunter, after an initially neutral stance, joins them, but soon does things his own way(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2005 musical stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music and dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show?(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.desc: A live-action, Mandarin-language adaptation of the popular 1958 children's book by author Zhang Tianyi, The Secret of the Magic Gourd follows the wondrous adventures of a young schoolboy named Wang Bao. When Wang Bao discovers a magical gourd that can instantly grant his every wish, the awkward child suddenly becomes a hero amongst his curious classmates. When the gourd proves more of a burden than a blessing and the boy decides to get rid of it, he quickly discovers that's easier said than done(n)

programme.title: Aliens in the Attic
programme.desc: A group of kids defend their holiday home from knee-high alien invaders in this adventure comedy. Shortly after Bethany Pearson and her family arrive at their summer home, four aliens show up and enslave her boyfriend Ricky via a powerful mind-control device. While the adults are completely oblivious to the extraterrestrial threat, the kids fight to save the planet with a little help from Sparks, the one friendly alien(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: The Great Muppet Caper is the second Muppet film and it is considerably more complex than its predecessor, The Muppet Movie, which was essentially just a road movie. As the film begins, Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are reporters who have failed to bag a story of a London jewel heist, which happened under their watch. The real criminals managed to escape and frame Miss Piggy as the thief. Kermit, Fozzie and the Great Gonzo set out on a mission to solve the mystery and track down the criminals who stole the Baseball Diamond. There are fewer star cameos and songs in The Great Muppet Caper than in The Muppet Movie, although appearances from John Cleese and Charles Grodin are particularly memorable(n)

programme.title: The Peanuts Movie
programme.desc: Charlie Brown, Snoopy, Woodstock and friends embark on an epic adventure in this charming adaptation of the beloved comic strip(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
programme.desc: Gina Prince-Bythewood's adaptation of Sue Monk Kidd's novel The Secret Life of Bees stars Dakota Fanning as Lily, a 14-year-old growing up in a small Southern town in 1964. She is haunted by memories of shooting her mother when she was a young girl. Lily lives with her emotionally distant father, and her best friend is their African-American housekeeper Rosaleen (Jennifer Hudson). After locals beat Rosaleen for attempting to register as a voter, and Lily's dad goes one step too far during an argument with his daughter, Lily and Rosaleen set out to find the place where the only picture Lily has of her mother was taken. That place turns out to be the home of the independent Boatwright sisters, a trio -- Queen Latifah, Sophie Okonedo, and Alicia Keys -- who make a very successful living producing honey. Lily and her friend move in with them, and soon the girl learns about both beekeeping and life(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey out of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization in this thrilling entry in the YA adventure series. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Ready to Rumble

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: Snow Angels
programme.desc: Director/screenwriter David Gordon Green adapts Stewart O'Nan's popular novel to the screen in this feature, which tells the parallel tales of a teenager named Arthur (Michael Angarano) and his onetime babysitter Annie (Kate Beckinsale) -- whose turbulent relationship with her estranged husband, Glenn (Sam Rockwell), leads the small-town waitress down a troubled path. Arthur is a high-school student from a dysfunctional family, and does everything in his power to avoid hanging around the house while mom and dad quarrel. When he's not practicing his trombone and performing with the high-school marching band, Arthur can usually be found bussing tables at the local Chinese restaurant and flirting with older waitress Annie. Annie used to be Arthur's babysitter, and is currently struggling to separate from her former high-school sweetheart, Glenn. But being a single mother isn't easy, especially since the troubled Glenn wants nothing more than to clean up his act and reunite his family. Back at school, Arthur and pretty classmate Lila (Olivia Thirlby) have been bonding over their mutual love for all things geeky. Though the casual friendship shows promise of evolving into something more when Lila expresses her true feelings for Arthur, he can't help but becoming distracted by his chaotic family life: his father is moving out of the family home, and his mother is doing everything in her power to maintain some semblance of normalcy. Realizing that happiness is fleeting as his family becomes shattered and Annie experiences a series of distressing encounters with Glenn, Arthur gradually begins to fall for Lisa despite his growing cynicism concerning long-term relationships. Later, on a cold winter morning, Glenn and Annie's past catches up with them in a blinding flash, and the lives of everyone they know are suddenly and irrevocably changed(n)

programme.title: Criminal

In time, Charles Xavier (James McAvoy) and his charges must work together to save the planet from this threat. New additions to this X-Men team include the elusive Nightcrawler (Kodi Smit-McPhee), fiery Cyclops (Tye Sheridan), and telepathically gifted Jean Grey (Sophie Turner). Rose Byrne, Jennifer Lawrence, and Olivia Munn co-star(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: Director Christopher Nolan follows up his breakthrough sophomore film Memento with this remake of a stylish Norwegian thriller. Al Pacino stars as Detective Will Dormer, a Los Angeles Police Department legend who temporarily escapes an internal affairs investigation that may ruin his career by traveling to Nightmute, AK, the remote site of a murder that has the local authorities flummoxed. Along with his partner, Hap Eckhart (Martin Donovan), and the small town's wide-eyed rookie investigator, Ellie Burr (Hilary Swank), the exhausted Dormer probes the brutal slaying of a teenage girl who was rumored to have a secret lover. A clever ruse quickly lures the killer into a police trap, but the suspect escapes and a tragic accident at the scene leaves Dormer at the mercy of the murderer, a pulp crime novelist named Walter Finch (Robin Williams). As Finch plays a dangerous game of extortion with Dormer, the detective's mental health deteriorates rapidly from guilt over his complicity in a crime and sleep deprivation compounded by the lack of darkness in the land of the midnight sun. Meanwhile, the bright and dogged Ellie continues putting the pieces of a complex puzzle together despite Dormer's skillful attempts to lead the investigation toward the right suspect, but away from his own malfeasance. Insomnia co-stars Paul Dooley, Nicky Katt, Maura Tierney, and Jonathan Jackson(n)

programme.title: Jesse Stone: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Transplanted L.A. cop Jesse Stone (Tom Selleck) attempts to solve the murder of a teenage girl while simultaneously dealing with a deadly case of domestic violence in this mystery that marks the third cinematic outing for novelist Robert B. Parker's eponymous detective. Having recently settled into his position as the police chief of Paradise, Massachusetts, Stone is troubled to learn that the body of a former straight-A student has been found floating in a nearby lake. Later, as Stone delves ever deeper into the case, he finds that the girl had grown increasingly self-destructive in her last days and that her parents hadn't even bothered to report her missing. His investigation around the quiet New England town yielding little to go on, Stone ventures into the city to search for clues and has a frightening brush with the Boston mob. With every inquiry Stone makes, he appears to be moving farther away from the truth than ever before. Though a disturbing instance of explosive domestic violence momentarily distracts the detective from the task at hand, Stone's determination quickly turns to obsession when he begins to feel as if he may finally be on track to solving the case(n)

programme.title: Jesse Stone: Sea Change
programme.desc: The fourth installment of the Jesse Stone series finds restless New England police chief Stone (Tom Selleck) fighting boredom by attempting to solve a twelve year-old cold case involving a murdered bank teller. Jesse Stone is a transplanted L.A. cop who thrived on big city adrenaline, but ultimately buckled under the pressure. Exiled to Paradise after suffering though a nasty divorce and being busted for drinking on the job, Stone now leads a quiet life of writing parking tickets and trying to suppress the urge to cut loose with the booze and babes. When one of his officers out on maternity leave and the other recovering from a recent gunshot wound, Stone turns to some old cold cases to keep himself occupied. Twelve years ago, a local bank teller was killed in broad daylight. Though the gunman responsible for the crime was never brought to justice, Stone soon uncovers a crucial piece of evidence that went overlooked during the original investigation. Now, as this once-cold case gradually begins to heat up again, Stone continues his investigation into an alleged rape that tool place aboard a yacht during Race Week(n)

programme.title: Jesse Stone: Thin Ice
programme.desc: Jesse Stone and Captain Healy are shot during an unauthorised stake-out in Boston. Meanwhile, a cryptic letter sent from Paradise leads the mother of a kidnapped child to Stone. Though her son was declared dead, she hopes he will reopen the case(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: A-Plumbing We Will Go. One of The Three Stooges best Columbia shorts, this picture begins with the boys in a typical situation -- they're down and out and on trial for stealing chickens. They manage to get off, but find themselves in trouble once again when they go fishing...in a pet store's fish tank. They escape from a cop with the use of a magician's disappearing act and drive off in a plumber's truck. The estate the trio land on has a leaky pipe, so the Stooges do their best to fix it -- which means they just about destroy the whole house. One of the best gags shows Curly Howard in the bathroom, screwing pipe onto pipe onto pipe until he's caged in -- the answer to his dilemma, of course, is to drill through the floor. Later, the lady of the house shows off her new "television receiver" to some guests (quite a novelty in 1940!). A live shot of Niagara Falls turns into a real-life Niagara as a gush of water smashes through the screen. Not surprisingly, a chase results from the mayhem. Th! e magician from earlier in the short is part of the afternoon's entertainment, and the Stooges emerge from his disappearing box -- as do a number of cops and a couple of police motorcycles(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.sub-title: Oily to Bed, Oily to Rise
programme.desc: Oily to Bed, Oily to Rise. The Three Stooges, broke and looking for work, are given a meal and some chores by a kindly widow with three daughters. They soon find out that three con men have swindled the widow out of the deed to an oil well on her land. The Stooges set out to catch the crooks and return the widow's deed to her(n)

programme.title: Machete Kills

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: John McTiernan's cult sci-fi actioner stars Arnold Schwarzennegger as Major Dutch Schaefer, leader of an elite commando unit sent into the jungles of South America to rescue government officials who have been kidnapped by terrorists. But as the group make their way into the jungle they realise they have been misled on the mission as they discover the mutilated bodies of the terrorists. But, as they endeavour to return home, somebody, or something, pursues them. As his group starts being wiped out one by one, Dutch realises he is up against a warrior not of this world - one equipped with superior weapons and strength and invisibility. In the end, the battle comes down to mano a mano as the two face off, as the invisible Predator finally reveals his true self(n)

programme.title: Predator 2

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: (2002) For the right price, ex-Special Forces officer Frank Martin (Jason Statham) will take anything anywhere. He just has three rules: no changes to the plan; no real names; no opening the package... But when one package starts to move of its own accord, he discovers the beautiful Lai (Shu Qi) concealed within it. But when Martin delivers her to the unscrupulous Darren "Wall Street" Bettencourt (Matt Schulze), his conscience soon gets the better of him and he decides to track down Wall Street and his masters in a bid to rescue Lai.(n)

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's WWII blockbuster stars Tom Hanks as Capt John H Miller, leader of a platoon of D-Day soldiers ordered to find and rescue Private Ryan, part of the advance forces who is now the sole surviving sibling of a family of four brothers. The plan, a propaganda exercise propagated by Army chief George C Marshall, sees them reluctantly give up on their mission to defeat Germans and set out on their quest (although not without diversions along the way). But when they eventually find Ryan, the moral question posed by Spielberg is - what do they do next?(n)

Also joining Aled this morning is Game of Thrones star Iain Glen, who will be returning to the small screen as Ser Jorah Mormont when the fantasy series begins next month. Plus, music by Elkie Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Griff's Great Britain
programme.desc: Griff Rhys Jones sets out to explore eight very disparate kinds of quintessentially British terrain, investigating how they have dictated different ways of living, working and playing - both in the past and as they are now - across the entire country, while also unearthing quirky and funny facts en route. He begins by heading to the South Downs, which are situated in Hampshire and East and West Sussex, taking to the air for a bird's eye view and attempting to get to know one of the region's woolliest inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: After weeks of tough auditions and five fiercely competitive semi-finals, the national talent search comes to a close as the remaining acts perform one last time. Memory duo DNA, singer Kyle Tomlinson, magicians Issy Simpson and Matt Edwards, young comedian Ned Woodman, pianist Tokio Myers, dance group Mersey Girls, veteran singers the Pensionalities, comedian Daliso Chaponda and the Missing People Choir are the hopefuls - plus the wildcard chosen by Simon Cowell, David Walliams, Amanda Holden and Alesha Dixon. The aim of the finalists is to win a slot at this year's Royal Variety Performance and get their hands on the £250,000 cash prize. All they have to do is impress the viewers at home. Presented by Ant and Dec. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis
programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the women's singles final on the 14th day's play at Roland Garros, which was won by Garbine Muguruza last year. The Spaniard, whose previous best finish at a Grand Slam came when she finished runner-up to Serena Williams at Wimbledon in 2015, picked up her first and so far only Major victory with a 7-5, 6-4 over the American last year. With analysis from Marion Bartoli, Jim Courier and Martina Navratilova, commentary by Nick Mullins and Sam Smith and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Live International Football
programme.sub-title: World Cup Qualifier Live: Scotland v England.
programme.desc: Scotland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Coverage of the Group F fixture, which takes place at Hampden Park, as the old rivals meet for the 114th time. Gordon Strachan will know victory - or at the very least a draw - is imperative here if his men are to stand a realistic chance of qualification, while a win for Gareth Southgate would put England in a dominant position in their quest to reach the finals in Russia. This is the first meeting between the sides on this ground since November 1999, when Kevin Keegan's England secured a 2-0 victory in the first leg of a UEFA Euro 2000 play-off thanks to a brace from Manchester United midfielder Paul Scholes. Presented by Mark Pougatch, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley, Glenn Hoddle and Kevin Gallacher, and analysis from Ian Wright, Ally McCoist, Lee Dixon and Ryan Giggs.(n)

programme.title: The Voice Kids
programme.desc: Emma Willis introduces the junior version of the singing talent contest, giving youngsters between the ages of eight and 14 a chance to achieve stardom. The Voice UK's Will.i.am returns as one of the three coaches, with McFly's Danny Jones and pop star Pixie Lott occupying the other two spinning red chairs. Up for grabs this time is a £30,000 prize to contribute to the winning child's musical education, along with a family holiday to Disneyland Paris.(n)

programme.title: Horrible Bosses
programme.desc: A power-crazed bully, a sleazy cocaine addict and a sexual predator each make an employee's life a misery, but the three workers cannot afford to quit their jobs. They resort to desperate measures by conspiring to murder each other's bosses, with a little help from an eccentric ex-convict. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis, Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Aniston and Colin Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury: Fell Walk: Pen-Y-Ghent, Yorkshire.
programme.desc: At 694 metres in height, Pen-y-ghent is the smallest fell on the Yorkshire Three Peaks Challenge, but the dramatic summit affords far-reaching views above the Dales, with plenty of surprises en route. The peak lies 3km east of Horton in Ribblesdale and the Pennine Way links the summit to the village. As Julia reveals, the route is around 5km in length, as the Way curves initially to the north before turning east to reach the summit.(n)

programme.desc: John Inverdale presents coverage of the men's singles final on the 15th day's play at Roland Garros, where Novak Djokovic defeated Andy Murray in last year's showpiece match. Djokovic completed a career Grand Slam with his 3-6, 6-1, 6-2, 6-4 win, becoming the first man since Rod Laver in 1969 to hold all four major titles at once and the first man in history to do so on three different surfaces. With analysis from Jim Courier, Mark Petchey and Fabrice Santoro, commentary by Nick Mullins and reports from Celina Hinchcliffe.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved.(n)

programme.title: The Loch
programme.desc: New series. programme.desc: Chris grows increasingly uncomfortable with his weight and visits a cosmetic surgeon to arrange liposuction. However, it is Peter who ends up having the procedure - and his new appearance causes him to become vain and self-obsessed.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's editor is found dead, having apparently committed suicide, but the amateur sleuth remains unconvinced and sets out to uncover the truth. Angela Lansbury stars, with Dennis Boutsikaris and Robert Desiderio.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is shocked to discover one of her writing students has been arrested on suspicion of murdering his stepfather, and makes a bid to help clear the boy's name. Angela Lansbury, Robert Beltran and Billy Gallo star.(n)

programme.title: The Nun's Story
programme.desc: An independent-minded woman enters a convent and develops a gift for medicine, while struggling to curb her rebellious nature. Drama, based on Kathryn C Hulme's novel, starring Audrey Hepburn, Peter Finch, Peggy Ashcroft, Dean Jagger and Mildred Dunnock.(n)

programme.title: The Nun's Story

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: After receiving a chilling phone call, the detective and sidekick DC Presley stumble on an exotic animal smuggling ring at a farm - where it appears an old adversary of Frost has been eaten by a crocodile. Meanwhile, a couple return from holiday to find the naked corpse of a man in their bedroom, prompting the husband to assume his wife was having an affair. Starring David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective investigates after a botanist accidentally unearths the body of a recently buried professor who was fixated upon solving a seemingly impossible riddle by Lewis Carroll. The victim had a long-standing rivalry with his brother - giving Lewis and Hathaway an obvious suspect - but the case is hindered by the mind games of two students who seem intent on causing trouble in their quest to gain admittance to a mysterious club. Guest starring Celia Imrie and James Fleet, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Lady Virginia Revel receives a marriage proposal from an ambitious politician, but is reluctant to accept it, especially as she is also being courted by a dashing young suitor. Accompanied by Miss Marple, she travels to a weekend party at her family home Chimneys, hoping to reach a decision. Negotiations for the sale of the country house are taking place during the gathering, but when new owner Count Ludwig of Austria is found murdered, St Mary Mead's elderly spinster must identify the culprit. Whodunit, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast including Gavin & Stacey stars Ruth Jones and Mathew Horne, plus Dervla Kirwan, Charlotte Salt, Michelle Collins, Jonas Armstrong and Edward Fox.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: When Jacko Argyle is executed for the murder of his stepmother, his family attempt to put the tragedy behind them, until a stranger provides an alibi that proves Jacko's innocence. Suspicion falls on every member of the household when it transpires that they all are much happier since the death of the matriarch. Miss Marple is conveniently on hand to solve the mystery. Geraldine McEwan stars, with Juliet Stevenson, Denis Lawson and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bullard asks Barnaby to investigate the disappearance of a friend's daughter who was a member of the Oblong Foundation, a cult based at Malham Hall. Jones goes under cover as a new recruit to solve the mystery, but he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion, which could be linked to the missing woman. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Will Knightley, Kevin Doyle, Holly Aird, Barbara Flynn and John Woodvine.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When a man's charred remains are found after an explosion, Foyle's investigations lead him to a top secret intelligence organisation. With murder and deception rife among its members, the race is on to find out the truth, but the detective's discoveries threaten his future career. Wartime drama, starring Michael Kitchen with guests Angela Thorne, Ronald Pickup and Samuel West.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A body is found with a note reading `They Must Be Destroyed' - a chilling reminder of a case Brooks was involved in six years previously, when extreme racist Andrew Dillon killed three boys from ethnic minorities. Steel is then put under intense scrutiny when it is revealed that his success in convicting Dillon was largely due to selective prosecution. Bradley Walsh and Ben Daniels star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate a hospital department where three patients have died in suspicious circumstances in six months - the latest being a woman brought into A&E with flu-like symptoms. The detectives learn she died after being given a lethal cocktail of prescription drugs - but with an unsigned patient chart and an extremely busy evening on the ward, tracking down the killer proves challenging. Crime drama, guest starring James Fox, with Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When a toddler goes missing from a high-street merry-go-round, his distraught mother reports him kidnapped and a massive police hunt is launched to track him down. However, with more than one suspect and no physical evidence, the search throws up more questions than answers - especially as the boy's mum seems to be hiding something. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

While she attempts to comfort the victim's bereaved spouse, Bellamy is shot in the arm and sets out in pursuit of the rifle-toting villain. Drama, with Jason Durr making his final appearance as Mike Bradley.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Aidensfield residents are up in arms over the noisy lorries rumbling through the village on their way to Jim Pinder's quarry, and David joins the protest, only to end up spending a night in the cells. Sheep are stolen from Lily Barton's land, and her neighbour promptly becomes the prime suspect - only for her farm to be set alight. Meanwhile, Bellamy strives to fan the flames of passion with Gina. Jean Alexander guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A chief accountant is found murdered just as the New York store where he worked is about to be sold to a museum of cultural history. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury, with Peter Donat and Kate Mulgrew.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates when Seth disappears without trace, and discovers a link to a 20-year-old crime.(n)

programme.title: Death on the Nile
programme.desc: Detective Hercule Poirot investigates a murder on board a paddle steamer in Egypt. The victim was an unpopular heiress, whose outspoken manner put her at odds with most of her fellow passengers during their cruise on the Nile. Agatha Christie mystery, starring Peter Ustinov, Bette Davis, Maggie Smith, George Kennedy, Mia Farrow, Jane Birkin, Olivia Hussey, Angela Lansbury and David Niven.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Worthy amateur choir is thrown into panic when baritone Connor Simpson is killed on the eve of the prestigious regional Four Choirs competition. A birdwatcher is also murdered shortly after, and DCI Barnaby and DC Jones uncover bitter rivalry and tense marital relationships as they try to establish if there is a connection between the two cases. Peter Capaldi guest stars.(n)

programme.title: When Phillip Met Prince Philip: 60 Years of the Duke of Edinburgh's Award
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield learns about Prince Philip's youth programme over the course of a year marking its 60th anniversary, meeting the Duke at celebrity galas, special receptions and intimate events. The This Morning host talks to David Walliams, Judi Dench and Joanna Lumley to help understand the Duke and how he embodies the award, and also chats to Prince Edward and his wife Sophie, Countess of Wessex, who give a unique glimpse of life inside the royal family and the time and work the Duke still invests in the scheme he founded.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Animal Orphans
programme.desc: Comedian Paul O'Grady returns with another Animal Orphans, and having previously visited Africa, he now travels farther east to find out about the rehabilitation of orphaned wild animals in the Malaysian part of Borneo. In the first of two parts, he heads for the orang-utan rehabilitation centre in Sepilok, where he discovers how the animals are being threatened by forest fires, learns about the damage that overfishing is doing to sea turtles' natural habitat, and tries to persuade a gibbon to climb a tree - a skill it needs to learn before it can return to the wild.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: Joanna begins a 2,000-mile journey across Japan in Hokkaido, where she meets one of the most important animals in Japanese culture, the red-crowned crane. She arrives in Sapporo during the middle of the annual Snow Festival and meets members of the local indigenous community, before travelling into the Fukushima exclusion zone and taking a bullet train from Nagano to Tokyo.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A call girl is found murdered at an upmarket apartment, apparently the victim of a client who risks losing everything if his secret obsession with the woman is revealed. Leading the cross-examination, Phillips begins to suspect someone had a reason to frame the accused, and doggedly pursues the truth. Guest starring Greg Wise, with Bradley Walsh and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A murder inquiry is launched when the police are alerted to shocking internet footage showing a teenage girl being attacked and shot. The investigation is hindered by the lack of a body, but the video provides enough clues to eventually put a name to the victim and track down her killers. However, a vow of silence between the defendants means Jake and Alesha face one of their toughest court battles yet.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur spots a potential darts champion and enters him in a contest, where he duly gets nobbled. Undeterred, the dodgy dealer comes up with the idea of staging his own darts tournament. However, fewer players than expected enter, and Arthur is left scrambling to raise the prize money. Comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Action from Donington Park, featuring the Renault UK Clio Cup and the Ginetta GT4 Supercup. Presented by Richard John Neil.(n)

programme.title: The Classic Car Show
programme.desc: Quentin Willson heads to the French Riviera to drive the silver Ferrari Dino once owned by Keith Richards of the Rolling Stones, while Jodie Kidd heads to the Autodrome de Linas-Montlhery to examine the history of the French motor-racing circuit. Chris Routledge uncovers the wartime history of the Morris 8, Alex Riley drives a 1958 MG A roadster in a rally in the Highlands, and Bruno Senna takes to the track in an Austin Healey 3000.(n)

programme.title: Live French Open Tennis

Sam and Mike revel in the fact that they're hospital gossip. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone

Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick, Jo and Katie prepare to leave Aidensfield, while miscellaneous bumps in the night make Greengrass wonder if his house is haunted. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is abducted by an old Army friend and former Japanese PoW camp inmate, whose wife's death has left him mentally unbalanced, while Greengrass is well and truly fleeced by father-and-son con-men. Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and John Alderton star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl takes an overdose and Blaketon's mysterious private life comes to light when his car goes missing and is involved in an accident. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: After enjoying a trip to the theatre with Captain Hastings, the detective is disturbed by the sound of gunshots in an apartment at Whitehaven Mansions, and soon finds himself investigating a murder. Drama, starring David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth takes a break on the island of Rhodes, where an English beauty draws attention by flirting with fellow guests at the Palace Hotel. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of 29-year-old Niall is made difficult by those closest to him, who seem intent on obscuring the facts, and it is not until the body of a drug dealer washes up on a beach that the dreadful truth begins to emerge. While coping with revelations of her own, Vera sifts through evidence of the grief, love and addiction that characterised Niall's life as she tries to find out why someone wanted him dead. With Judy Parfitt (Call the Midwife) and Phyllis Logan (Downton Abbey).(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Cold Is the Grave - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The detective is drawn into the criminal underworld of Soho when he reluctantly accepts an unofficial request from Chief Superintendent Rydell to find his missing daughter. Meanwhile, an armed robbery in Eastvale turns into a murder investigation after the perpetrator is found dead in his home and when a battered body is found in a local nightclub, the identity of the victim leads Banks and Cabbot to a devastating realisation about both cases.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.sub-title: Cold Is the Grave - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. A surveillance operation establishes a clear link between the murders of Charles McKay and Barry Clough and the subsequent investigation takes a number of alarming twists before uncovering a conspiracy pointing to one of the team being an informer. As Banks pushes all the suspects hard, the case threatens to undermine his integrity as an officer and brings his relationship with Cabbot to breaking point. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Ventress investigates missing golf balls, and some lads break into a local war hero's home. Rural police drama, starring Derek Fowlds and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Hazel's Roost in Bainbridge, North Yorkshire, where Lithuanian-raised host Millie Bussey hopes to prove that her establishment offers the best value for money. However, despite being full of praise for the cleanliness of their rooms, some of her guests claim to feel cramped, while others believe the style is too dated.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Rhandregynwen Hall in Llanymynech, Powys, where owner Mark Johanssen's country manor impresses his guests on arrival. However, drawers in need of dusting, an abundance of cobwebs and breakfast blunders dent the host's chances of victory.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest moves to the Smart and Simple hotel in Tunbridge Wells, Kent, where owner Simon Colbran and his assistant manager Rebecca Heasman want their rivals to agree that the accommodation lives up to its name. The guests are wowed on arrival, but Cathy and her son Alex aren't swept off their feet by their `dark and corporate' bridal suite.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Cathy Robinson and her son Alex welcome the contestants to the Pearfield Bed and Breakfast in Petersfield, Hampshire, and want to impress them by providing a homely experience. The hosts receive largely positive feedback from their guests, but Millie Bussey manages to find some flaws.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps a couple who have decided to relocate, but are struggling to make up their minds about their preferred destination. Nick has his eyes on a property in the West Country, while Sarah wants them to move to the Lake Vinuela area, north of Malaga in Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple who are struggling to decide where they should relocate receive guidance. Graziella Clarke spent a year in Seville, Spain, during her time as a student, and would love to return to the city. However, her husband Robert is not so sure, and instead proposes a move to Dorset.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer guide more prospective property buyers through the complex world of viewings and agents. They begin in Cambridgeshire, where they help Chris and Louise find their dream home in a rural setting, while also looking at properties in Cambridge for a pair of doctors and first-time buyers.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first in a week of parties in Norwich is hosted by hotel events manager Jo-Anne, who hopes a glamorous gourmet affair will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize. As the five competitors take their places at Jo-Anne's dinner table, conversation takes an eclectic turn, covering everything from the Queen, Josie Gibson and Linda Robson to leopard-print pants and hovercraft.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Down-to-earth multimedia manager Karena hosts the second night in Norwich, where she hopes to impress her guests with some slightly more refined pub-style food, despite questionable table manners and hairy fish during the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former professional skier Jake hosts the third dinner party in Norwich, and hopes to impress his fellow contestants with a menu of fine dining and alpine classics. With the help of his mother, he decorates his house to create a winter wonderland, but the games he wants to play leave some guests feeling as if they are at a children's party.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Music shop manager Barnaby takes the reins of the fourth night in Norwich, and after a fish-inspired starter and a main course of seafood linguine, his guests appear to be getting into the party spirit. However, it seems his only chance of scooping the prize money rests with his entertainment after ending up with a huge pile of leftovers - and a bleeding finger.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the night of the final dinner party in Norwich and the turn of business advisor Richard to host. He believes his Thai cooking will give him the edge in the competition, but has his work cut out as Jo-Anne is out to test his ego. Meanwhile, punk rocker Richard feels the spirit of rebellion and hopes to claim the cash prize for himself before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at 20 Albany Street in Edinburgh, where mother and daughter Denise and Heather Walker hope their B&B will win over their fellow competitors. First impressions seem a success, with each of the guests happy with the high standards of the rooms, however one couple do not hesitate to comment on their poor night's sleep.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners visit the Highland Guesthouse in Callander, run by Tom and Angela Jones. The guests are impressed by the hotel's cleanliness on arrival, but not everyone enjoys a traditional Scottish dancing activity - or the morning bagpipes.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is the Fairfax Hotel in Skegness, where owner Kath Milward makes an early departure after a subdued dinner fails to wow her guests. Things do not look up for the hostess when Denise and Heather Walker discover something in their toilet, and Tom and Angela Jones decide to go on the hunt for a new room.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sally Brealey welcome the contestants to the Wolds Village guest house in Bainton, East Yorkshire, where they will stay in themed rooms, but Kath Milward is not impressed with the gothic decor. The hosts organise an afternoon of mosaic-making, pitting Denise Walker against her artistic daughter Heather, and their breakfast gets the guests' approval. However, at feedback time some criticism comes as a shock.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Denise and Heather Walker from Albany Street tackle what they feel are unfair comments over the comfort of one of their beds, while Tom and Angela Jones of the Highland Guest House apologise for the lingering paint smells during Chris and Sally Brealey's time at their hotel. Kath Milward from the Fairfax Hotel discusses her low hosting scores from the other owners and accuses them of not being sympathetic, and Chris and Sally Brealey of Wolds Village challenge a complaint about bed size.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter and fishing enthusiast travels along four of England's greatest rivers, exploring their history, traditions and wildlife. The first episode follows the Tweed along the English-Scottish border, where he helps to shear Cheviot sheep, tags osprey chicks, goes in search of Merlin's grave and discovers the origins of famous border ballads.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas returns to narrate another light-hearted retrospective poking fun at Britain's viewing habits in the 1970s. This time, he focuses on the world of comedy, unfettered as it was to the conventions of political correctness. A selection of clips from hit TV shows illustrate how, if viewers were not straight, white, middle-class men, they were at risk of being offended, and highlights examples from On the Buses, The Two Ronnies, Dave Allen at Large and The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club. Includes commentary and contributions by Melvyn Hayes, Eric Chappell, Bill Oddie, Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Grace Dent, Nish Kumar, Ellie Taylor, Joel Dommett and Phil Wang.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with clips and reactions to programmes from people not around to watch them at the time. This edition focuses on 70s-style education, with a look at the lessons conveyed about society and sex, as well as lazy national stereotypes and the casual attitude of TV towards the health and safety of members of the public.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Regular team captain Sean Lock is joined by Liza Tarbuck to battle guest captain Sarah Millican and team-mate Romesh Ranganathan as Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the comedy panel quiz show mash-up. Susie Dent is ably assisted by Phill Jupitus in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley deals with the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Bill Bailey taking on special guest captain Joe Wilkinson and Isy Suttie. Susie Dent is joined by Joe Lycett in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas returns to narrate another light-hearted retrospective poking fun at Britain's viewing habits in the 1970s. This time, he focuses on the world of comedy, unfettered as it was to the conventions of political correctness. A selection of clips from hit TV shows illustrate how, if viewers were not straight, white, middle-class men, they were at risk of being offended, and highlights examples from On the Buses, The Two Ronnies, Dave Allen at Large and The Wheeltappers and Shunters Social Club. Includes commentary and contributions by Melvyn Hayes, Eric Chappell, Bill Oddie, Krishnan Guru-Murthy, Grace Dent, Nish Kumar, Ellie Taylor, Joel Dommett and Phil Wang.(n)

programme.title: It Was Alright In
programme.desc: Matt Lucas narrates another look back at TV shows from past decades, with clips and reactions to programmes from people not around to watch them at the time. This edition focuses on 70s-style education, with a look at the lessons conveyed about society and sex, as well as lazy national stereotypes and the casual attitude of TV towards the health and safety of members of the public.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Guests Tim Westwood, Lauren Laverne, David O'Doherty and Matthew Crosby join host Jimmy Carr for an extended edition of the irreverent panel show in which teams captained by Jon Richardson and Sean Lock answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps first-time buyers Lucy and Joe, who have set their heart on a cottage in the Cotswolds, where they can start a family. However, Joe wants a project and has already discounted hundreds of potential homes online, so it looks like he's going to be hard to please. Phil's search is just as difficult in Bristol, where country boy Paul and city girl Elly want a home with outside space that's close to the railway station. Finding somewhere that ticks all the boxes could be tricky.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps homeowners Richard, Jackie and Robert improve their West Sussex properties in the hope that buyer Eliza will make them a lucrative offer.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Andy Macbeth and Jo Denton, Christchurch earthquake refugees, are building a new life and a modern-day fortress against the elements in alpine Queenstown.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first in a week of parties in Newcastle is hosted by mother and workaholic Clare, who aims to impress her guests with an Indian-themed menu of spicy pakoras and lamb curry in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedy promoter David hosts the second night in Newcastle, where he aims to impress his guests with a fine-dining menu featuring caviar, scallops, beef fillet and oysters, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize. However, some of the guests have reservations about the host, meaning he has his work cut out for him.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third night in Newcastle sees sophisticated marketing consultant Liz trying to impress her guests with a fancy French-themed menu. However, she spends most of her time trying to keep the peace as outspoken comedy promoter David annoys club singer John and rubs mum-of-three Clare up the wrong way with his snobbish views.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Club singer John hopes that a menu inspired by his travels around the world will help him win the £1,000 prize as he hosts the fourth night in Newcastle. He also has a musical surprise in store for his guests, but faces a challenge trying to impress David who refused to take part in the fun and games on Liz's evening. However, further rifts appear in the group when Vicky wants to discuss Geordie icons.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the night of the final dinner party in Newcastle and the turn of hotel administrator Vicky to entertain her guests. However, there is tension in the air and the spiritual host is challenged to keep the peace when John lets David know exactly what he thinks of him. The theme of negativity continues as mum-of-three Claire and Liz both take the comedy promoter to task over his questionable sense of humour, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, where Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her housekeeper Fran Birch hope to demonstrate that their B&B offers the best value for money. The quirky pair's hosting style proves a hit with some of their guests, before others reveal their competitive side during a Charleston dance lesson.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon on their second outing, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock hope to impress their peers. But things do not run smoothly, as the guests are left unimpressed with the decor and discover nasty surprises in some of the drawers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third B&B of the week is pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal, Kent, where owner Michael Prime is joined by his mum Lorna. On arrival, Marianne Abben and Fran Birch love the seaside-inspired room, but entrepreneur Mark Genders is far from thrilled by the `no frills' experience. Over dinner, tensions run high after self-confessed trouble-maker Marianne asks Mark to reveal which of the group he would and would not employ, and Lorna gets short shrift when she puts forward her application.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Genders welcomes the contestants to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire and hopes they will approve of his small but perfectly formed rooms. He organises an ale-tasting activity, although it fails to please all of his guests. Michael and Lorna admit they have seen a new side of Mark - however, will it affect their feedback?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners settle some scores and discover how much they have been paid, before the winner is revealed. Marianne and Fran from Langsmeade House begin by explaining that their worn rug is in fact a 200-year-old antique, Natasha and Dal from Stratford House confront Michael and Lorna about their strong language and cleaning techniques, while Mark Genders compares his experience at Edmund House to flying with a low budget airline.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Construction site manager Mark hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Kent, hoping a fun-fuelled evening will impress his guests Karen, Verush, Amrick and Anthony.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the second night in Kent, competitive sales assistant Verush is going all out to win by hosting a Czech-themed evening, but ex-stripper Mark isn't impressed, comparing Verush's pasta to MDF and pastry to leather, while the first night's argument between dog lover Karen and photographer Anthony is reignited.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog enthusiast Karen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Kent, hoping to impress her guests by serving up a menu inspired by her four-legged friends. After the cheesy fun of the previous night, she is determined to impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Amrick takes his turn to host in Kent, hoping to wow his guests by revealing his musical talents and with his traditional Indian cuisine. But with dog-lover Karen and competitive Verush not liking hot and spicy food, there could be trouble - while photographer Anthony questions ex-stripper Mark's dress sense.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Anthony attempts to wow his guests with an evening of fine food and culinary excellence on the final day of the competition in Kent. However, the soiree is jeopardised by ex-stripper Mark on overdrive and dog-lover Karen showcasing some incredible impressions from animals to Anthony himself. The host might be cockily confident he can win, but Karen seemingly remains in pole position to bag the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: The Hi Way elephant family have been hit with a potentially deadly virus affecting animals in captivity and in the wild. With the youngest members of the family most at risk, the keepers and Chester Zoo's veterinary team do all they can to combat the mysterious illness. Meanwhile, Mac the stallion zebra is introduced to the zoo's three mares in the hope they will produce much needed offspring for this endangered species. There's also a look into the bizarre world of the naked mole rat.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Jack, Dougal and Ted head off for a summer break at a caravan park. However, they immediately get on the wrong side of their fellow holiday-makers, and matters become even more dire when Father Noel Furlong turns up - with his hapless youth group in tow. Comedy, guest starring Graham Norton.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The priests organise a raffle to raise funds to repair their leaky roof, planning to award a car as the prize. Unfortunately, Ted accidentally wrecks it before the grand draw takes place, and embarks on a frantic search for a replacement. Dermot Morgan and Ardal O'Hanlon play the Craggy Island clerics.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Loved Sitcoms
programme.desc: Documentary, celebrating some of the many classic sitcoms that have entertained British audiences over the past 50 years, narrated by Tamsin Greig, herself a star of the likes of Friday Night Dinner and Black Books. Along the way, she takes in everything from modern `game-changers' such as The Office, Twenty Twelve and Peep Show, to vintage shows including The Likely Lads, Dad's Army and Steptoe and Son. Making use of a cross-generational poll, she presents a countdown that reveals which show has become the most revered sitcom of all, and a host of stars including Mrs Brown's Boys' Brendan O'Carroll, One Foot in the Grave's Richard Wilson, Blackadder's Tony Robinson and Keeping Up Appearances' Patricia Routledge share their thoughts on working on some of the nation's most treasured comedy dramas.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Henning Wehn taking on guest captain Bill Bailey and Jessica Hynes. Susie Dent is joined by Tom Allen in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)
